p: Rift Valley fever (RVF) is a viral zoonosis that affects mainly animals but is also found in humans. It is caused by an RNA virus of the Phlebovirus genus (Bunyaviridae family), the genome consisting of three RNA segments: large, medium, and small [ 1, 2]. RVFV is transmitted mainly by infected mosquitoes of the Aedes and Culex genuses, but humans can be contaminated by direct contact with blood (e.g. aerosols, absorption) or tissues (e.g. placenta of stillborns from infected animals) [ 3, 4].
